intro: Barbarea plantaginea, commonly known as the yellow rocket, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbages and mustards. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, typically from March to May. Its leaves are alternate, lobed, and often covered in a fine layer of pubescence. Barbarea plantaginea is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in meadows, where it thrives in full sun.
